Definition: The title of the resource.
An alternative name for the resource.
A person or organization responsible for creating the resource.
A person or organization responsible for making contributions to the resource.
An entity responsible for making the resource available.
An account of the resource.
A language of the resource.
General nature or type of the resource (e.g., image, text, etc.). Does not capture aboutness.
A person or organization owning or managing rights over the resource.
Information about rights held in and over the resource expressed in general terms (i.e. boilerplate statements).
Information about who can access the resource or an indication of its security status.
An associated license for the object (i.e. Creative Commons license, software licenses, etc.). Defines use/reuse of resources.
A related resource in which the described resource is physically or logically included.
A related resource in which the described resource is physically or logically included.
Date of creation of the original resource.
Date of formal issuance (e.g., publication) of the resource.
Date on which the resource was changed, i.e., digitized.
The topic of the resource.
A name of the person that the resource is about.
Spatial characteristics of the resource.
Temporal characteristics of the resource.
The genre, form, and/or physical characteristics of the resource being described. The material or physical carrier of the resource. Does not capture aboutness.
Description or statement indicating the extent, size, or duration of the original, physical resource for digitized content.
Keywords (i.e. non-standard terms) assigned to the resource.
An archival accession number for the resource.
The identifier for the collection to which the resource belongs.
